syllabus:
**National Taiwan Normal University**

**110 Fall Semester (110 – 1)**

**English (III) syllabus**

Instructor: Huynh Hai-Long (Harry) / 黃海龍

Email: longhhuynh@ntnu.edu.tw

Class time: 週一，3-4節 Monday periods 03 – 04 / 10:20am – 12:10pm, 線上 Online via Google Meet (\*)

_(\*) The first **03** meetings will be from 10:15am to 12:10pm, from 09/22 to 10/12 on Google Meet (_[_click here_](https://meet.google.com/jjg-evfw-bhr)_)._

*   **Course description**

This course aims to improve students’ Academic English proficiency with a strong focus on reading, speaking and writing in Academic English. In this course, there will be a range of activities which engage students in contemporary topics with practical issues, sharpen their critical thinking, and boost their communicative abilities. They also learn to teamwork with their peers and to become more autonomous learners.

*   **Course objectives:**

The course is designed to

1.  Develop students’ communicative skills in Academic English
2.  Expand and enhance students’ knowledge of academic vocabulary in Education
3.  Build students’ confidence in communication in English
4.  Develop students’ teamwork and autonomy
5.  Broaden cultural and intercultural knowledge

*   **Classroom materials**

Book chapters and journal articles in Education, videos on YouTube and some online writing pieces. The full list of these materials will be available on September 20.

*   Grading policy and course requirements

1.  Grading policy

1.  Attendance: 10%
2.  Participation in group discussion and classroom activities: 15%
3.  Summaries: 15%
4.  Mid-term – presentation: 30%
5.  Final – essay: 30%

1.  Course requirements:

*   _Attendance and participation (10%)_

Class attendance is required and strictly checked. Students are expected to come to class every week, except for (a) hospitalized cases; or (b) emergencies; or (c) authorized absences. For these exceptions, evidence with the signature and stamp of the person in charge must be provided. Any absences apart from the exceptions mentioned above are counted, and each absence results in 1 point deducted in the attendance/participation score. If the classes are online, students are required turn on the camera/webcam all the time.

*   _Participation in discussion and activities (15%)_

Students must participate in all discussions and class activities. They are required to answer questions the teachers posted on Moodle or shown in pre-recorded videos. Any time a students fails to do this will result in 10% deducted in this part.

*   _Summaries (15%)_

Students are expected to compose summaries of assigned readings. The lecturer will discuss with the students which readings to summarize and set due dates for these summaries. Late submissions will result in 30% deduction in the score for summaries. A submission which is received 2 days or later than due date will be instantly marked zero. If there is an emergency happening on the due date, students should email the lecturer as soon as possible.

*   _Mid-term (30%) and final (30%)_

For the mid-term test, students will work in groups of three or four and will present on one of the topics given. The presentation must last from 6 to 8 minutes.

For the final test, students will work individually and will write an essay on one of the topics learned. Each essay will be marked on 3 criteria: Topic Development (Task Response), Organization (Coherence and Cohesion), and Delivery (Vocabulary and Grammar). See scoring guide based on [TOEFL iBT Independent Writing Rubrics](http://www.ets.org/s/toefl/pdf/toefl_writing_rubrics.pdf) (page 1).
